page.title: 10FARMER'S MOTHER INTERVIEWED
page.content: We visited the home of, the farmer who showed us round Bluegates. She was given this cottage when she married in 1936. Mrs. Wolverley Fordham owned it as well as Bluegates Farm, the large house called Ashwell Bury and Mill Street Cottages. The small three up three down cottage had much added on. Old beams and even an old staircase from the Bury were used. Edward Lutyens the architect removed the latter after a fire at the Bury. We were interested to hear about the lady's brother. We saw a photo of him. He was a reconnaisance pilot in WWII. She said he was the sort of man who relished danger. Always a perfect- tionist he returned unofficially a third time to get some better pictures and was shot down and killed. He got the DSO. His name was Anthony Eustace Hill, his name is on the church spire.
